document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge of the immature stages of Palaearctic species of the genus Anthonomus Germar (Coleoptera: Curculionidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the knowledge of the immature stages of Palaearctic species of the genus Anthonomus Germar (Coleoptera: Curculionidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: A. N. Severtsov Institute of Ecology and Evolution, Russian Academy of Sciences, 33 Leninskiy Prospect, Moscow, 119071 Russia.; fatsiccor 66 @ mail. ru

heading.emphasis:
Key to known immature stages of the Palaearctic species of the genus
Anthonomus

subSubSection.paragraph:
The larva and pupa of
A . rectirostris
and the pupae of
A . pedicularius
and
A . pyri
have not been studied by me and are included according to the works of Burke (1968) and Ahmad & Burke (1972) . It should be borne in mind that according to the works of Marvaldi (1997 ; 1999 ), des
3 in
the sense of Ahmad and Burke should be called des 4 , while des 4 , respectively, des 3 , pds 5 on meso- and metathorax are alar setae ( as ). I did not include the larva of
A . bisignifer
described by Lee & Morimoto (1996) in the key (see discussion).

paragraph.keyLead: - Epicranium with five dorsal setae ( des 4 present) ( Figs. 6 , 23 , 42 , 89 )............................................ 5

2 . Endocarinal line is more than 2/3 as long as frons. Epipharynx with two als . Meso- and metathorax with short pds 1 and long pds 2 . Pda 5 very short...............................................................
A . ( Furcipus ) rectirostris

- Endocarinal line is about 2/3 as long as frons ( Figs. 56 , 72 ). Epipharynx with three als ( Figs. 59 , 75 ). Meso- and metathorax ( Figs. 53 , 69 ) with long
pds 1
and short
pds 2
. Pda 5 minute..................................................... 3

3. On meso- (Th2) and metathorax (Th3) ( Fig. 69 ) pds 1 and pds 3 —long, pds 2 and pds 4 —short, as —long......
A . (s. str.) latior
- On meso- (Th2) and metathorax (Th3) ( Fig. 53 ) pds 1 , pds 3 , pds 4 —long, pds 2 —short, as —short....................... 4

4. Body length: 2.62–3.16 (mean 2.89). Pedal lobe with one long, two medium and two minute pda ( Fig. 53 ). Mala of maxilla on ventral side with four vms ( Fig. 61 )......................................................
A . (s. str.) conspersus

- Body length: 3.04–3.78 (mean 3.34). Pedal lobe with two long, two short and one minute pda . Mala of maxilla on ventral side with five vms ......................................................................
A . (s. str.) pedicularius

- Pms 1 — short or medium, as long as pms 3, or slightly longer than pms 3 ( Figs. 11 , 28 , 94 ). Abdominal segments with short e ps 1, short ps , and very short lsts ( Figs. 4 , 21 , 87 )................................................................ 7

6 . Body length: 3.78–4.78 (mean 4.25). Host plants:
Malus
,
Pyrus
.................................
A . (s. str.) pomorum

- Body length: 2.87–4.11 (mean 3.49). Host plants:
Padus
,
Padellus
,
Cerasus
.......................
A . (s. str.) incurvus

7. Head dark brown ( Fig. 1 ). Four epipharyngeal sensilla combined in a single median cluster ( esc ) ( Fig. 8 ). Prothorax (Th1) ( Fig. 3 ) with ten prns ; prns 1 medium. Pedal lobe ( Fig. 3 ) contains only two long pda (the rest of the pda short or minute)....................................................................................
A . ( Anthomorphus ) pinivorax

- Head pale yellow or brownish yellow ( Figs. 18 , 85 ). Four epipharyngeal sensilla combined in two clusters with two pores in each ( Figs. 26 , 93 ). Prothorax (Th1) ( Figs. 20 , 87 ) with eleven prns ; prns 1 short. Pedal lobe ( Figs. 20 , 87 ) contains either three or four long pda (the rest of the pda short or minute)......................................................... 8

8. Pedal lobe ( Fig. 20 ) with four very long pda . Eus 1 on thoracic segments (Th1–3) long ( Fig. 20 ). Mala of the maxilla on the dorsal side with six dms , on the ventral side with four vms ( Fig. 28 )..........
A . ( Anthonomidius ) rubripes Gyllenhal, 1835

- Pedal lobe ( Fig. 86 ) with three very long and one very short pda . Eus 1 on thoracic segments (Th1–3) short ( Fig. 86 ). Mala of the maxilla on the dorsal side with five or six dms , on the ventral side with five vms ( Fig. 94 ).....................................................................................................
A . (s. str.) rubi (Herbst, 1795)
